page.title: 02WHEAL PROSPER MINE
page.content: At Rinsey there is an old mine. Its name is Wheal Prosper. Wheal is cornish for mine. There are a few paths branching off from the circle of grass where the old engine house now stands. One of them is just a steep slope, another leads to the car park while the other goes along the cliff top. Along this path is the quarry associated with the mine. Just off the beach is a rock called Welloe which can only be seen at low tide. Wheal Prosper Mine was used for mining tin and copper. It was built in 1869 and was restored in 1970 by the National Trust which owns the surrounding land.
